Package be.uantwerpen.fti.ei.Java2D

Class Java2DWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uantwerpen.fti.ei.Java2D.Java2DWorld
  • public class Java2DWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to load sprites, to resize them and to create, draw and render the 2d graphics screen.
    Author:
    Bavo Lesy

        public void loadSprites()

      • resizeImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage resizeImage​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage inputImage,
                                                int targetWidth,
                                                int targetHeight)
        This method resizes the image to visualise our screen correctly.
        Parameters:
        inputImage - The image that is being resized.
        targetWidth - The width of the new image.
        targetHeight - The height of the new image.
        Returns:
        outputImage The resized image.

      • Draw

        public void Draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws the image on the screen.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object that contains information needed to draw.

      • resizeSprites

        public void resizeSprites​(int screenWidth,
                          int screenHeight)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method sets the frame size and resizes the different sprites to visualise our screen correctly.
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - The width of the resized sprites.
        screenHeight - The height of the resized sprites.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the image is not resized correctly.

      • loadSpriteSizes

        public void loadSpriteSizes()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This methods loads the different sprite sizes from the config file to ensure our visualisation is correct.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the config file is not read correctly.
